gurmukhi: bwx pRjMq bFq inqpRiq qn ]ins idn Gwq krq idj dyvn ]
transliteration: Baan Prajant Badhat Nitprat(i) Tan|| Nis Din Ghaat Karat Dij Devan||
translation: His body increased in length everyday by the length of an arrow and he destroyed the gods and twice-born night and day.

gurmukhi: dIrGu kwieAY so irpu BXo ]riv rQ htk cln qy gXo ]8]
transliteration: Deeragh(u) Kaaiai So Rip(u) Bhayo|| Rav(i) Rath Hatak Chalan Te Gado||8||
translation: On the birth of the enemy like deeraghkaya, even the chariot of the sun hesitated to move.8.

gurmukhi: htk clq rQu BXo Bwn kopXo qbY ]AsqR ssqR lY clXo sMg lY dl sBY ]
transliteration: Hatak Chalet Rath(u) Bhayo Bhaan Kopyo Tabai|| Astra Sastra Lai Chadyo San Laid Al Sabhai||
translation: When the chariot of the sun stopped moving, the sun, then in great fury, marched forward alongwith his arms, weapons and forces.

gurmukhi: mMfXo ibbD pRkwr qhwN rx jwiekY ]ho inrK dyv Aru dYq rhy aurJwiekY ]9]
transliteration: Mandyo Bibadh Prakaar Tahaan Ran Jaaekai|| Ho Nirakh Dev Ar(u) Dait Rahe Urjhaaekai||9||
translation: He started various types of war seeing which both gods and demons, experienced a dilemma.9.

gurmukhi: gh gh pwx kiRpwx dubhIXw rx iBry ]tUk tUk huAY igry n pg pwCy iPry ]
transliteration: Gad Gad Paan Kridaan Doubaheeyaa Ran Bhire|| Took Took Huai Gire Na Pag Paachhe Phire||
translation: Holding their swords in their hands, the warriors of both the side, fought with one another in the battlefield. They fell, having been chopped into bits, but still they did not retrace their steps.

gurmukhi: AMgin soBy Gwie pRBw Aq hI bFy ]ho bsqR mno iCtkwie jnyqI sy cFy ]10]
transliteration: Anad(i) Sobhe Ghaae Prabhaa At Hibadhe|| Ho Bastra Mano Chhitkaae Janetise Chadhe||10||
translation: Having been wounded, their increased still further and they appeared like the members of the marriage party walking and exhibiting their dressers.10.
Hearing the resounding of the trumpets, the clouds are feeling shy.

transliteration: Ghan Han Ghoran|| Jan Ban Moran||11||
translation: The army is swelling forward like the clouds, from all the four side, and it appears that there is a large gathering of peacocks in the forest.11.

transliteration: Dhal Hal Dhaalan|| Jim Gul Laalan||
translation: The luster of the shields appears like the red roses.

transliteration: Khad Bhad Dhaalan|| Tad Sad Tderan||12
translation: The movement of warriors and the shooting of arrows are creating different distinct sounded.12.
